Clinical: Skin, affections of. Stomach, affections of.
Characteristics: Imperatoria, like Athamanta, belongs to the genus Peucedanum. Kleemann observed the effects of the infusion of the root, a teaspoonful every two hours. Only a few symptoms were noted, but they were peculiar. "Diminished secretion of mucus in intestines and air passages" is noteworthy.
Head: Active orgasm and confusion of the head.
Stomach: Feeling of warmth, starting in stomach and extending over whole body.
Abdomen: Diminished secretion of mucus in intestines.
Respiratory Organs: Diminished secretion of mucus in air passages.
Skin: Itching and burning in the skin.
Fever: Feeling of warmth starting in stomach and extending over whole body.
